properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Dunkeld, Glenthompson, Narrapumelap, Stavely, Wickliffe, Lake Bolac, Narrapumelap South
properties.webBody:
The Threat is Reduced following the bushfire at Dunkeld, Glenthompson, Lake Bolac, Narrapumelap, Narrapumelap South, Stavely and Wickliffe. 

  • This Advice message replaces the Watch and Act issued at 7:32pm, Friday 27 December 2024.
The Grampians National Park remains closed to visitors for further details visit the Parks Victoria website. No access is permitted to the National Park. 

  • There is a bushfire in the Grampians National Park this is not yet under Control.
  • The spread of the bushfire has slowed for now, but the situation can change at any time.
A Community Meeting is being held at Dunkeld on Saturday 28th December 5:00pm at Sterling Place, Dunkeld Community Centre, 14 Sterling Street, Dunkeld. 

A Community Newsletter is now available. 
People located within the area are now able to resume normal activities.
Impacts in your area:
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures. 
  • Smoke from bushfires can reduce air quality and may affect your health. For more information visit the Better Health website. 
  • Impacted Wildlife - Call 1300 356 882 or download the Wildlife Emergency App. 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.  

This will be the final message issued for this fire. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 

Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text: ADVICE - BUSHFIRE - Threat Is Reduced Incident Location: Grampians National Park Issue Date: Saturday 28 December 2024, 02:17 pm Next Update: Saturday 04 January 2025, 02:20 pm More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35505/moreinfo The Threat is Reduced following the bushfire at Dunkeld, Glenthompson, Lake Bolac, Narrapumelap, Narrapumelap South, Stavely and Wickliffe. - This Advice message replaces the Watch and Act issued at 7:32pm, Friday 27 December 2024. The Grampians National Park remains closed to visitors for further details visit the Parks Victoria website. No access is permitted to the National Park. - There is a bushfire in the Grampians National Park this is not yet under Control. - The spread of the bushfire has slowed for now, but the situation can change at any time. A Community Meeting is being held at Dunkeld on Saturday 28th December 5:00pm at Sterling Place, Dunkeld Community Centre, 14 Sterling Street, Dunkeld. A Community Newsletter is now available. People located within the area are now able to resume normal activities.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: area surrounding Lake Wartook, including Lake Lonsdale, Wartook and Zumsteins
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for area surrounding Lake Wartook, including Lake Lonsdale, Wartook and Zumsteins.

This Advice replaces Advice issued on 2:17pm, 28 December 2024.

The Grampians National Park remains closed to visitors for further details visit the Park Victoria website. No access to the park is permitted.

A Community Meeting is being held in Laharum on Sunday 29th December at the Laharum Hall, 1574 Northen Grampians Road, Laharum.

A Community newsletter is now available. 

  • The bushfire is still not yet under control, the spread of the bushfire has slowed for now, but the situation can change at any time. 
  • The winds are expected to be west-south-westerly during coming days.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • Smoke from bushfires can reduce air quality and may affect your health. For more information visit Better Health website.
  • Impacted Wildlife - Call 1300 356 882 or download the Wildlife Emergency App.
Recovery and Resilience 
If you have been / may be impacted by the current bushfires in Victoria, it is understandable if you are feeling concerned and experiencing a mix of strong mental, emotional or physical reactions right now. 

Over the holiday season, try to focus on what is within your control, such as staying up to date with the latest warnings and alerts at www.emergency.vic.gov.au (or the VicEmergency App on your mobile phone), and reviewing your personal emergency plan. 

For emergency relief information during major incidents, call the VicEmergency hotline on 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief
Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighting vehicles and heavy equipment are still working in the area, be mindful of the increased traffic. 
  • Trees can be extremely dangerous after a fire and during high winds. 
  • Smoke from bushfires can reduce air quality and may affect your health. For more information visit Better Health website.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.transport.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 04/01/2025 05:10 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text: ADVICE - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed Incident Location: Grampians National Park Issue Date: Saturday 28 December 2024, 05:06 pm Next Update: Saturday 04 January 2025, 05:10 pm More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35515/moreinfo This Advice message is being issued for area surrounding Lake Wartook, including Lake Lonsdale, Wartook and Zumsteins. This Advice replaces Advice issued on 2:17pm, 28 December 2024. The Grampians National Park remains closed to visitors for further details visit the Park Victoria website. No access to the park is permitted. A Community Meeting is being held in Laharum on Sunday 29th December at the Laharum Hall, 1574 Northen Grampians Road, Laharum. A Community newsletter is now available. - The bushfire is still not yet under control, the spread of the bushfire has slowed for now, but the situation can change at any time. - The winds are expected to be west-south-westerly during coming days. There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information is being issued for Calivil .

  • There is a haystack fire at Calivil Mail Rd, Calivil. 
  • Haystack fires are not likely to spread into grassland but do generate a lot of smoke.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby roads and communities.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by the Country Fire Authority.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 

  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app.
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to cal VicEmergency
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
COMMUNITY INFORMATION - GRASS FIRE - Stay Informed
Incident Location: Calivil Mail Rd, Calivil
Issue Date: Friday 27 December 2024, 07:46 am
Next Update: Sunday 29 December 2024, 07:50 am

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35450/moreinfo

This Community Information is being issued for Calivil .

- There is a haystack fire at Calivil Mail Rd, Calivil. 
- Haystack fires are not likely to spread into grassland but do generate a lot of smoke.
- Smoke may be visible from nearby roads and communities.


There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.location: eastern side of the Grampians National Park from Moyston to Bornes Hill, including Mafeking, Watgania and Maroona
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for the area on the eastern side of the Grampians National Park from Moyston to Bornes Hill, including Mafeking, Watgania and Maroona

This Watch and Act replaces the Watch and Act issued at 5:06pm, 28 December 2024.  

Halls Gap and the Grampians National Park remains closed to visitors. For further details visit the Parks Victoria website. No access is permitted to the National Park.

Residents only are allowed to return to their properties via Traffic Management Points, proof of address will be required. 

  • Residents accessing the fire affected area must remain vigilant, as tree hazards may be present. Many roads within the fire affected areas have not been assessed and remain closed due to tree risk. Crews will be undertaking assessment and treatment over the coming days. 
  • Firefighting vehicles and heavy equipment and aircraft are still working in the area, be mindful of the increased traffic. 
  • The bushfire at Grampians National Park is not yet under control.   The spread of the bushfire has slowed for now. 
  • The fire situation can change at any time,  you must monitor conditions and be ready to act. 
Community Meetings 
A meeting will be held in Moyston on Saturday 28th December at the Moyston Recreation Reserve, 2 Moyston-Great Western Road starting at 7.00pm

Further Community Meetings are planned for Sunday 29th December at the Willaura Hall at Main Street, Willaura. 

A Community Newsletter is available via this link. 

The threat is reduced, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
What you should do:  
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Enact your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family. 
  • Impacted Wildlife - Call 1300 356 882 or download the Wildlife Emergency App.
Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. Remember to: 
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area. 

Recovery and Resilience 
If you have been / may be impacted by the current bushfires in Victoria, it is understandable if you are feeling concerned and experiencing a mix of strong mental, emotional or physical reactions right now.   

Over the holiday season, try to focus on what is within your control, such as staying up to date with the latest warnings and alerts at www.emergency.vic.gov.au (or the VicEmergency App on your mobile phone),and reviewing your personal emergency plan. 

For emergency relief information during major incidents, call the VicEmergency hotline on 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief
Impacts in your area: 
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
  • Fire fighting vehicles and heavy equipment are still working in the area, be mindful of the increased traffic. 
  • Smoke from bushfires can reduce air quality and may affect your health. For more information visit the Better Health website. 
  • Trees can be extremely dangerous during a bushfire or high winds. Do not stand, park or travel in areas of fire affected trees.
  • Bushfires can spread quickly and are extremely dangerous.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.   

The next update is expected by 29/12/2024 08:20 pm or as the situation changes.   

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.   
Accessibility: 
  • The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

Halls Gap and the Grampians National Park remains closed to visitors. For further details visit the Parks Victoria website. No access is permitted to the National Park. Residents only are allowed to return to their properties via Traffic Management Points, proof of address will be required. - Residents accessing the fire affected area must remain vigilant, as tree hazards may be present. Many roads within the fire affected areas have not been assessed and remain closed due to tree risk. Crews will be undertaking assessment and treatment over the coming days. - Firefighting vehicles and heavy equipment and aircraft are still working in the area, be mindful of the increased traffic. - The bushfire at Grampians National Park is not yet under control. The spread of the bushfire has slowed for now. - The fire situation can change at any time, you must monitor conditions and be ready to act. Community Meetings A meeting will be held in Moyston on Saturday 28th December at the Moyston Recreation Reserve, 2 Moyston-Great Western Road starting at 7.00pm Further Community Meetings are planned for Sunday 29th December at the Willaura Hall at Main Street, Willaura. A Community Newsletter is available via this link. The threat is reduced, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Grampians, Mirranatwa, Victoria Valley.

  • This Advice replaces the Watch and Act issued at 7:10pm, 27 December 2024.
  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park that is not yet under control.
  • The bushfire is travelling from Grampians National Park in an easterly direction.

Community Meetings are being held at Mirranatwa and Dunkeld on Saturday 28th December.

  • Mirranatwa - 2:30pm Mirranatwa Hall, School Road, Mirranatwa. 
  • Dunkeld - 5:00pm Sterling Place, Dunkeld Community Centre, 14 Sterling Street, Dunkeld.

There is currently no threat to this warning area, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
  • The spread of the bushfire has slowed for now, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.

A Community Newsletter is now available.

Impacted Wildlife - Call 1300 356 882 or download the Wildlife Emergency App.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighters, heavy machinery and aircraft will remain in the area.
  • Residents accessing the fire affected areas must remain vigilant, as tree hazards may be present. Many roads within the fire affected areas have not been assessed and remain closed due to tree risk. Crews will be undertaking assessment and treatment over the coming days. 
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.transport.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 04/01/2025 01:20 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Halls Gap and Pomonal. 

This Watch and Act replaces the Watch and Act issued at 7.06pm 27 December 2024.

Halls Gap and the Grampians National Park remains closed to visitors for further details visit the Park Victoria website.  No access is permitted to the National Park.

Residents only are allowed to return to their properties via the Traffic Management Points, proof of address will be required. 

  • Residents accessing the fire affected areas must remain vigilant, as tree hazards may be present. Many roads within the fire affected areas have not been assessed and remain closed due to tree risk. Crews will be undertaking assessment and treatment over the coming days. 
  • Avoid standing, parking and travelling in fire affected areas. Firefighters are working to complete hazardous tree assessments. 
  • The bushfire is still not yet under control, the spread of the bushfire has slowed for now. Fire is still active in the Lake Bellfield area.
  • You must monitor conditions and be ready to act. 
  • Firefighters, heavy machinery and aircraft remain in the area, be mindful of the increased traffic. 

Community Meetings are being held in Pomonal and Halls Gap on Sunday 29th December 2024. 

  • Halls Gap - Centenary Hall, 117-119 Grampians Road, Halls Gap
  • Pomonal - Pomonal Community Hall, Ararat Halls Gap Road, Pomonal 

A Community newsletter is now available. 

The threat is reduced, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
What you should do:  
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Enact your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family. 
  • Impacted Wildlife - Call 1300 356 882 or download the Wildlife Emergency App

Recovery and Resilience 
If you have been / may be impacted by the current bushfires in Victoria, it is understandable if you are feeling concerned and experiencing a mix of strong mental, emotional or physical reactions right now.

Over the holiday season, try to focus on what is within your control, such as staying up to date with the latest warnings and alerts at www.emergency.vic.gov.au (or the VicEmergency App on your mobile phone), and reviewing your personal emergency plan.

For emergency relief information during major incidents, call the VicEmergency hotline on 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief

Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. Remember to: 
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area or Stawell or Ararat.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighters, heavy machinery and aircraft will remain in the area.
  • Residents accessing the fire affected areas must remain vigilant, as tree hazards may be present. Many roads within the fire affected areas have not been assessed and remain closed due to tree risk. Crews will be undertaking assessment and treatment over the coming days.   
  • Smoke from bushfires can reduce air quality and may affect your health. For more information visit Better Health website.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.transport.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.   

The next update is expected by 29/12/2024 05:10 pm or as the situation changes.   

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.   
Accessibility: 
  • The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.location: Long Gully Road to College Road area, east of Mt William
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Long Gully Road to College Road are, east of Mt William. 

This Watch and Act message replaces the Watch and Act issued at 7:15pm, 27 December 2024.

  •  It is Not Safe to Return to Long Gully Road to College Road area, east of Mt William.
  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park is not yet under control. 
  • The bushfire in Grampians National Park is travelling in an easterly direction.
  • The spread of the bushfire has slowed for now, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
  • There are numerous trees impacted by fire in the area and it is not safe to enter. Many roads within the fire affected areas have not been assessed and remain closed due to tree risk. Crews will be undertaking assessment and treatment over the coming days.

Community Meeting are being planned for Pomonal and Halls Gap on Sunday 29th December, monitor VicEmergency-Grampians for specific details. 

A Community Newsletter is now available via this link.


If you left the area from Long Gully Road to College Road in the impacted fire area, it is Not Safe to Return. 
Be aware of potential dangerous bushfire and tree hazards.
What you should do:

If you have not already left: 
  • Stay where you are and avoid dangerous bushfire and tree hazards.
  • Check you have enough food, drinking water and medications - if you do not, phone Triple Zero (000) for assistance.
If you have already left: 
  • Do not return to your home until a Safe to Return notification is issued.
Recovery and Resilience 
If you have been / may be impacted by the current bushfires in Victoria, it is understandable if you are feeling concerned and experiencing a mix of strong mental, emotional or physical reactions right now.

Over the holiday season, try to focus on what is within your control, such as staying up to date with the latest warnings and alerts at www.emergency.vic.gov.au (or the VicEmergency App on your mobile phone), and reviewing your personal emergency plan.

For emergency relief information during major incidents, call the VicEmergency hotline on 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief
Impacts in your area:
  • Bushfires can spread quickly and are extremely dangerous.
  • Trees can be extremely dangerous during a bushfire or high winds. Do not stand, park or travel in areas of fire affected trees.
  • Smoke from bushfires can reduce air quality and may affect your health. For more information visit the Better Health website.
  • Impacted Wildlife - Call 1300 356 882 or download the Wildlife Emergency App.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.transport.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
The Grampians National Park remains closed. Further information can be found at the Grampians (Gariwerd) National Park Website.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria. 

The next update is expected by 29/12/2024 02:40 pm or as the situation changes. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 
Accessibility: 
  • The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline. 
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Mount Howitt Walking Track and camping area
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for the Mount Howitt Walking Track and camping area.

  • This Advice replaces the Advice message issued at 2:13pm Friday 27 December.
  • The bushfire near the Mount Howitt Walking Trail is still not yet under control.
  • It is travelling in an easterly direction.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • The Mount Howitt Walking Track is closed.
  • The Mount Howitt trailhead camping area and car park are closed.
  • Firefighters are responding to this fire.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads.
  • Aircraft are operating in the area.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 29/12/2024 06:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
ADVICE - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed
Incident Location: Mount Howitt Walking Track and camping area
Issue Date: Saturday 28 December 2024, 04:28 pm
Next Update: Sunday 29 December 2024, 06:00 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35514/moreinfo

This Advice message is being issued for the Mount Howitt Walking Track and camping area.

- This Advice replaces the Advice message issued at 2:13pm Friday 27 December.
- The bushfire near the Mount Howitt Walking Trail is still not yet under control.
- It is travelling in an easterly direction.


There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Bullengarook.

  • This Advice replaces the Advice issued at 10.07pm Thursday 26 December.
  • The bushfire at Coffeys Rd, Bullengarook is now under control.
  • Crews will continue to blackout over the weekend. 
There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
  • Listen to ABC Ballarat 107.9 FM (www.abc.net.au/ballarat) or ABC Radio Melbourne 774 AM (www.abc.net.au/melbourne).
Impacts in your area: 
  • The following roads remain closed: Coffeys Road, Carrolls Lane and Waterloo Flat Road.
  • Numerous tracks within the Wombat State Forest are closed, including Finger Point Road and several adjoining tracks.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads.
  • Firefighters will remain in the area.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 29/12/2024 10:10 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

ADVICE - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed
Incident Location: Coffeys Rd, Bullengarook
Issue Date: Friday 27 December 2024, 10:08 am
Next Update: Sunday 29 December 2024, 10:10 am

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35452/moreinfo

This Advice message is being issued for Bullengarook.

- This Advice replaces the Advice issued at 10.07pm Thursday 26 December.
- The bushfire at Coffeys Rd, Bullengarook is now under control.
- Crews will continue to blackout over the weekend. 


There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
